data:
Alison Coil News and Awards Extreme Star Formation Reveals a Fleeting Phase of Galactic Evolution Professor Alison Coil awarded extensive access to the Keck
Telescope over the next 4 years to undertake a new survey of distant galaxies Intense Bursts of Star Formation Drive Fierce Galactic Winds Professors Coil, Dudko and Anderson promoted. Suspects in the quenching of star formation exonerated AEGIS: The Clustering of X-ray Active Galactic Nuclei Relative to Galaxies at z~1 , 2009, ApJ, 701, 1484-1499, Coil, AL, Georgakakis, A, Newman, JA, Cooper, MC, Croton, D, Davis, M, Koo, DC, Laird, ES, Nandra, K, Weiner, BJ, Willmer, CNA, Yan, R. Ubiquitous Outflows in DEEP2 Spectra of Star-Forming Galaxies at z=1.4 , 2009, ApJ, 692, 187-211, Weiner, BJ, Coil, AL, Prochaska, JX, Newman, JA, Cooper, MC, Bundy, K, Conselice, CJ, Dutton, AA, Faber, SM, Koo, DC, Lotz, JM, Rieke, GH, Rubin, KHR. The DEEP2 Galaxy Redshift Survey:  Color and Luminosity Dependence of Galaxy Clustering at z~1 , 2008, ApJ, 672, 153-176, Coil, AL, Newman, JA, Croton, D, Cooper, MC, Davis, M, Faber, SM, Gerke, BF, Koo, DC, Padmanabhan, N, Wechsler, RH, Weiner, BJ. The DEEP2 Galaxy Redshift Survey:  Clustering of Quasars and Galaxies at z=1 , 2007, ApJ, 654, 115-124, Coil, AL, Hennawi, JF, Newman, JA, Cooper, MC, Davis, M. The DEEP2 Galaxy Redshift Survey:  Clustering of Galaxies as a Function of Luminosity at z=1 ,  2006, ApJ, 644, 671-677, Coil, AL, Newman, JA, Cooper, MC, Davis, M, Faber, SM, Koo, DC, Willmer, CNA. Alison Coil Ph. D., University of California at Berkeley, 2004 Office: SERF 426 Phone: 858-822-3940 acoil@ucsd.edu Observational astrophysics, with a focus on galaxy evolution, observational cosmology, and large-scale structure.
